text:
Hi,

We are in the midst of an Apache upgrade for which we are setting up version 2.4.25. The installation of this version 2.4.25 got completed about a week back and since then it is running without issues. However, on an avearge about 10 times daily, we can see the below message in our virtual host error_log.

Wed Jan 25 09:34:54.874498 2017] [proxy_connect:notice] [pid 15645:tid 20] [client xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:xxxxx] AH01026: err on backconn

By looking at some related threads, it seemed that a similar issue was resolved in version 2.4.11, so we being a higher version would have expected not to have encountered this. Can you provide any suggestions/workarounds for this?

Thanks in advance.
creator: soumik.mukherjee@dsm.com
ylavic.dev@gmail.com
text:
mod_proxy_connect detects a condition where the backend resets the connection which is then considered incomplete (as opposed to a clean close which usually marks the "normal" end of stream), hence the error message.

This is likely not a bug in Apache httpd (unless more details like related network traces contradict the above), but probably more a network/backend issue which could better be discussed on the users@ mailing list [1].

Closing this report for now, but feel free to reopen with more details (i.e. some evidence of a bug).

[1] users@httpd.apache.org
